movie_review_blurb: The hypnotic imagery and fragmentary tale explore the connections between place and personal identity.
This crude and unfunny comedy is easily the worst movie of 2012.
A surprisingly funny and crude comedy about a man's relationship with a talking teddy bear.
This reboot works with a freshness and seriousness that was often missing from the 2002 Tobey Maguire film.
A well-told tale of power, corruption and uncivilized people who use violence and murder to achieve success.
Unfocused and easily forgettable, this drama shows that even a likable actress can't carry a movie that undervalues its characters.
An intriguing (and sometimes off-putting) cinematic creation featuring Matthew McConaughey in one of his best performances.
A solid family-friendly film that embraces its quirky characters and their mischievous adventures.
movie_title: Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Dog Days (2012)

movie_review_blurb: This dramedy offers a refreshingly-honest and comedic look at an aging couple still trying to make their relationship work.
Wallowing in melodrama, the film's sole highlight is Whitney Houston's supporting turn in it.
From start to finish, the movie basks in horrible horror clich√©s that will leave viewers straining to find something original in the proceedings.
This sequel knows what its audience is looking for and succeeds admirably in providing it.
This fact-based drama succeeds because of its great cast and its strong story of loyalty and brotherhood.
A poorly-directly and terribly-executed mess of a motion picture that should have been left in the dark.
While the story is predictable, it compensates for that with great acting and a noble purpose.
Although the film suffers during certain plot developments, the set-up and much of the dialogue ring true in this dramedy.
The film's unique script strangely succeeds in mashing together both intense violence and grand comedy.
The cliched plot and terrible dialogue make this so-called "thriller" nearly unbearable.
It's difficult not to be impressed with director and screenwriter Ben Lewin's ability to bring this distinctive and surprisingly emotional story to the big screen.
This drama, which succeeds when the characters are in the water, has little to offer when they are back on land.
An offensive and obnoxious comedy that never feels secure in its own identity.
A well-crafted drama about three flawed individuals who changed the course of history in Denmark.
A unique dramedy that stands heads and shoulders above most romantic films.
An unconventional drama that succeeds despite an uneven plot.
Remains as wonderful and remarkably charming as it was when it was first released.
An emotionally-captivating and well-filmed true tale.
A joyless and crude comedy that celebrates bathroom humor.
A complete mess, this drama is packed with sophomoric political ideas, unfocused storylines and inane dialogue.
The greatest waste of A-list talent since Garry Marshall made his last film.
As unsubtle as its title, this action film is repetitive and packed with silly cliches that should be put to sleep.
Director Rupert Sanders and actress Charlize help elevate this otherwise forgettable fairy tale.
A surprisingly-funny zombie film boasting a killer soundtrack and a great script.
A cool concept is compromised when this film descends into predictable territory.
This comedy succeeds as a crude, inventive and humours look at a dumb despot.
A solid character study that is difficult to enjoy but hard not to appreciate.
Packed with too many storylines, this drama feels like a zoo indeed.
A solid tribute to the conservative icon despite its meandering focus on her failing health.
A modern-day classic that proves that Hollywood can still make incredible films.
Remains as wondrous and beautiful as ever.
An intriguingly verbose film about adult arguments, which aren't that different from playground jousts.
A patriotic but blatantly unremarkable film that could have been much much more.
This drama defies reason, logic and explanation but it can't defy gravity and ultimately falls flatly on its face.
A heavy-handed script and an obnoxious main character help sink this environmental drama.
A suspenseful and well-crafted old-fashioned ghost story.
A stirring and solid tribute to the late dance instructor.
The Force may not be strong in this episode, but it's there.
movie_title: Star Wars: Episode I - The Phantom Menace (1999)

movie_review_blurb: The film's three charming leads help make this superficial comedy worth seeing.
A powerful and relevant Shakespeare adaptation that firecely brings the story to life.
A simplistic and utterly-predictable morality tale.
A politically-incorrect and surprisingly uneven teen comedy that 20-somethings will likely enjoy.
Surprisingly funny and wickedly smart, this romantic dramedy soars.
This wannabe epic is forgettable, bland and way too long.
Lacking compelling characters, this comedy never fully works as a cohesive whole.
Director Gary Ross does a great job in bringing the thrilling novel to life in this uncompromising drama.
A complicated unflinching look at a boy struggling to thrive in a harsh world.
Slow-moving but graceful, this character study is engaging and insightful.
With dated jokes and a slew of unfunny scenes, this comedy fails to live up to its predecessors.
The dialogue between the two leads and Guy Pearce's pleasant performance make this sci-di drama worth seeing.
An original and audacious horror-comedy that oftentimes works better than it should.
A complacent uncomplicated family drama with simple yet endearing sensitivities.
Funny for families of all ages, this animated comedy is a rare and delightful treat.
A fun light-hearted summer blockbuster that is weighed down by a forgettable villain.
A thoughtful but over-stuffed documentary that grazes over a lot of big issues.
Long, loud and pedestrian, this drama only gets exciting in its closing minutes.
A provocative thriller that offers intelligence and solid surprises until its lame third act.
An enjoyable third act can't save this uneven comedy, which strives to be more serious than it should.
Director Sam Raimi creates a magical experience for viewers in this beautiful and engaging prequel to "The Wizard of Oz."
As lifeless and dull as any of the characters whacked during this dramedy's bloated running time.
An honest and powerful look at teenagers who look and act like real people.
Methodical, powerful and one of the year's best, this drama offers up a riveting script and a great cast.
A tired and manipulative comedy, this new film is one of the most creatively-inert flicks of the year.
A thoughtful, original and provocative feature-length directorial debut from Joseph Gordon-Levitt.
A bland retelling of a familiar story that lies in the shadow of smarter and sleeker films like 'The Firm.'
This masterpiece perfectly blends the elements of a science fiction blockbuster- A-list stars and amazing special effects- with a powerful and subtle story.
A decent script is brought to life because of the strong supporting players in this new comedy.
The year's best film, this drama is a cinematic achievement and will be impossible to forget.
This beautifully-directed drama succeeds to a certain experimental extent but drags on for a bit too long.
A bit lengthy but packed with great music, this is a solid documentary that musicians and fans of soul music will likely enjoy.
The script, packed with pretentious lines and silly dialogue, manages to dull even the most exciting and provocative parts of this story.
A commendable sc-fi drama, this serious film offers up some great themes and some grand visuals.
A powerful and insightful film about two controversial young writers who were never satisfied with the status quo and sought to change it.
Offering a unique insight into the Holocaust, this compelling drama works despite its uneven plot.
An intoxicating and profound romantic drama that offers new insights into our dependence on technology.
Packed with crass and obnoxious humor, this new comedy is a loser for all of the great actors involved.
Highly-watchable entertainment that had the potential to be much much more.
Fresh characters, a few fresh ideas and a new setting enliven this long-running film series.
A brutal and realistic war film that smartly focuses on the fraternal relationships these soldiers share before sending them into battle.
More accurately titled 'The Letdown of Hercules,' this Greek drama offers up threadbare characters and an excessive amount of slow motion.
With an obnoxious main character and little comedy, this animated comedy never really finds its footing and instead stumbles around like a drunken squirrel looking for a place to go.
Driven by strong characters and a villain's plot that actually makes sense, this action film delivers some great thrills and a thoughtful origin story.
Comedian Kevin Hart tries to earn a few laughs in this lame cop comedy but the inane script does him no favors.
Although the plot is formulaic, the strong performances and the empathetic main character make this drama stand out.
One fierce and unforgettable comedy that offers some stereotypes alongside a slew of belly laughs.
An honest and in-depth look at the former Massachusetts governor candidate during his two hard-fought presidential campaigns.
Aaron's Eckhart's solid performance can't make up for this feature's rotten script and its by-the-books third act.
Not since "The Hangover: Part III" has so many unlikeable male characters caused so much damage to themselves and to the innocent bystanders around them.
With superficial characters, this look at the British justice system is a dour disappointment.
A powerful and passionate film that presents its flawed characters in an honest and heartbreaking fashion that will be hard to forget.
A noble but unworthy effort that will likely disappoint viewers looking for a thoughtful look into the technological genius.
Two hours of brainless action packed with some great laughs and featuring two actors clearly enjoying their time together.
An intriguing concept is overshadowed by a remarkably outrageous third act.
A ridiculous, repetitive and empty drama.
This action-packed drama is as bland and forgettable as its predecessor.
A unique and heartening look at four young women blossoming into mature adults as they enjoy a bout with success in the midst of a hard-fought war.
An ambitious and thought-provoking film with a beautiful score and some of the biggest narrative twists of the year.
An (extremely) blood good time that will likely please horror fans.
Multi-layered and beautifully-filmed by Oscar winner Danny Boyle, this drama lets viewers into the world of art and hypnosis in a tale that should be talked about long after the credits roll.
A powerful tale about the dangers of spending a lifetime online or losing one's self to online fantasies or ideals.
This visually beautiful film falters with a meandering plot.
A surprisingly warm and heartfelt film about a flawed criminal struggling to start a new life after the birth of his first child.
Packed with graphic torture sequences and stinging comedy, this fact-based film's is bogged down by its unevenness.
A thought-provoking and original drama that takes an intriguing look at the competitive nature of the agricultural industry.
This messy and oftentimes obnoxious comedy relies too often on cheap humor to get its points across.
An ambitious, multi-colored triumph, this film will be hard to forget.
Set out the rodent traps for this lazy exercise in children's entertainment.
Not as audacious or exciting as its predecessor but this sequel is still a fun summer ride.
This sequel is obnoxious, unfunny, and disgusting, a far cry from the humorous original.
This satisfying comedy stands on the merits of its two leads and works predominantly because of Vince Vaughn's amusing performance.
This zombie thriller efficiently blends action sequences with investigative scenes exploring the history of the virus.
A hysterical comedy, this Paul Feig production is a worthy successor to his 2011 hit "Bridesmaids."
A decent- though not spectacular- summer spectacle that goes on for way too long.
A morass of metallic mayhem.
The rare horror film that critics and genre fans can actually enjoy.
The great interplay between the title character and his sarcastic brother Loki make this sequel worthwhile.
A wonderful family film that offers up some of Disney's best musical moments in years.
A magical experience, this well-written comedy will delight and entertain audiences everywhere.
More exciting than its predecessor, Peter Jackson's visual expertise helps guide this fun sequel.
movie_title: The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug (2013)

movie_review_blurb: A poignant and thoughtful character study of a drifting folk singer trying to succeed in New York in 1961.
A superficial supernatural story that aimlessly seeks to follow in the footsteps of 'Twilight.'
A highly-watchable but stilted sequel that serves as a complacent sequel to the fun original.
An honest and authentic documentary that powerfully explores the filmmaker's own family.
Offering up genuinely unlikable characters and terrible dialogue, this comedy qualifies as one of the year's worst.
Michelle Williams stuns in an Oscar-worthy performance in one of the year's best films.
A smart documentary that takes sides in the death penalty debate but never shies away from the horrendous crimes at the center of the story.
Overburdened with too many characters and a manufactured conclusion, "Twelve" wastes a solid performance by Chace Crawford.
"Piranha 3D," although cliched, embraces its genre and is a highly-enjoyable fun B-movie.
George Clooney delivers a strong but subdued performance in this slow-paced character study.
A surprising-engaging and beautifully-told story about young romance.
A tasteless and obnoxious "comedy," "Lottery Ticket" is easily one of the year's worst films.
A fun and engaging film with an exciting young cast making the most out of an uneven script.
The characters are unlikable and annoying but the suspense built up is very real, making "Devil" a thriller worth checking out.
Crass and obnoxious, "The Virginity Hit" is an atrocious and unfunny comedy.
Aaron Sorkin's amazing script and several great performances make this one of the best movies of 2010.
Sure, we know where the story is headed but a few funny scenes and the chemistry between the two leads make this a solid date movie.
Featuring caricatures instead of characters, "You Again" is a tired and formulaic comedy with few funny moments.
Intelligent and thought-provoking, this documentary may not be one of the best movies of the year but it's surely one of the most important ones.
Put your brain on hold for a few hours and you'll enjoy this light-hearted action comedy.
Hilary Swank delivers in this compelling tale of a woman who attends law school to prove her brother's innocence in court.
Superficially satisfying but oftentimes disappointing, "Hereafter" focuses on three major stories, one of which works far better than the other two.
"Due Date" begins with a bad dream and eventually feels like one. It's tired and formulaic and offers only a few mild laughs.
"For Colored Girls" features a lot of heartache and pain, but lacks any sense of purpose. It sacrifices depth for despair and suffers because of it.
It's hard not to have fun at this delightful comedy which features strong performances from McAdams, Ford and Keaton.
The 3D effects don't help at all in this bland and easily-forgettable entry in the long-running series.
This eye-opening documentary is critical of both parties in its search for answers about the causes of the 2008 economic collapse.
This penultimate entry in the series lacks the life and the imagination of its worthy predecessors.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 1 (2010)

movie_review_blurb: Inundated with liches and lazy plot twists, this Dwayne Johnson vehicle is a complete waste of time.
Director Tony Scott delivers in this exciting thrill ride.
Naomi Watt delivers but the script offers a lifeless story and too many one-dimensional characters to name.
A fun breezy drama that's fun to watch but will easily be forgotten in six months.
Powerful and well-acted, this drama meticulously captures the pain and perils of aging in a way that will be hard to forget.
An obnoxious and repulsive comedy that consistently wastes the talents of its two charismatic stars.
Its greatest crime is that the film goes on for way too long and loses momentum halfway through the proceedings.
A solid but unspectacular historical drama that sheds light on a little-known chapter of world history.
Melodramatic and off-putting, this Zac Efron drama is a complete mess.
A solid thriller that too often relies on action-- rather than character development-- to tell its intriguing story.
A smart and inventive thriller, this drama is one of the year's best movies.
Despite forgettable characters, this drama offers enough surprises to satisfy many fans of the long-running series.
An empty and cold drama that meanders aimlessly through a multitude of storylines.
A shallow and easily-forgettable thriller.
A cringe-worthy crude comedy that has more bark than bite.
An uneven story and crass comedy could leave viewers revolted.
The father-son relationship stands out in this sentimental and satisfying drama.
Well-written and well-acted, this cop drama is enlivened by the fraternal its relationships its two leads share.
This disjointed reunion dramedy really works in its final act, but that conclusion can't make up for what came before.
The film's reliance on action at the expense of character development diminishes its effectiveness.
An instant high school classic, this film truly captures the grand spirit of the novel.
movie_title: The Perks of Being a Wallflower (2012)

movie_review_blurb: Films like this don't need a lot of logic to survive but credibility goes out the window a few minutes after it starts and never returns.
With great performances from Bridges and Gyllenhaal, Crazy Heart is a winner and a must-see.
An impressive and gritty cop drama with three strong leading performances.
Some genuinely scary scenes aren't enough to save this tired and unnecessary remake.
An imaginative family film featuring a tremendously mischievous and likable lead character.
With great performances from Robert Downey Jr. and Ben Kingsley, this superhero adventure is a blast and a thrilling kick off to the summer of 2013.
One of the best Bond movie ever, this thriller offers up great action sequences and a smart dialogue.
A visual masterpiece that suffers from a few slight narrative flaws.
Stiller succeeds in a dramatic role but the script underwhelms with a meandering story and an unlikable lead character.
This drama is unabashedly preachy but satisfying nevertheless.
A predictable but sweet old-fashioned teen romance.
A fun, fast, action thriller with plenty of laughs.
This flimsy remake is a nightmare and unworthy of your time.
A grand superhero movie that features a brilliant performance by Robert Downey Jr., in one of his best roles.
Dark and depressing, this adventure lacks all of the excitement and joy of many of Robin Hood's previous adventures.
This comedy is an absolute waste of time and easily the worst movie of 2010.
A cliched mess, this comedy lacks the carefree humor of its superior predecessor.
A ridiculous and lifeless comedy, this mess of a motion picture is trite and easily-forgettable.
"The A-Team" combines over-the-top action scenes with lifeless jokes and the disappointing result is an uninspired action comedy."
This third "Twilight" film eclipses its predecessors but its anti-climactic story and its melodramatic tendencies still hold it back."
Scattered and uneven, this action drama wastes a terrific Tom Cruise.
By focusing this drama on the passage of an amendment, director Steven Spielberg has succeeded in making the 16th president a relatable man whose politcal victories were hard-fought.
A stunningly dull and oddly-paced drama that never seems fully aware of its own identity.
A smart and hilarious apocalyptic comedy.
Absolutely masterful in both its production and its performances, this drama is easily one of the year's best.
A gratifying story with a quietly powerful performance from funnyman Will Ferrell.
It often feels like there are two separate stories featured in this comic book flick but neither of them is particularly interesting.
Undoubtedly flawed, this animated film is still (barely) worth seeing.
A raunchy unpleasant comedy that wastes its talented cast.
An overlong ordeal, devoid of excitement and intrigue.
A likeable and light-hearted comedy that doesn't attempt to be anything more.
This vulgar comedy is mediocre at best with some fun performances but few jokes that actually work.
A charming and delightful film that the whole family can enjoy.
This enthralling film ends the series on a high note, exceeding expectations and delivering a fine conclusion to the films.
movie_title: Harry Potter and the Deathly Hallows - Part 2 (2011)

movie_review_blurb: A lifeless and clich√©d action film that never lives up to its title or its title characters' ideals.
A smart romantic comedy that both mocks and features romantic clich√©s.
The film is driven more by its concept than by its plot but it's still a fun summer film.
This well-cast comedy easily stands high above many of the romantic comedies we've seen in recent years.
This creepy and well-made drama offers up a few light-hearted moments to go along with its scares.
This inane comedy lives down to its title.
A great story and a wonderful cast combine to make this drama a must-see.
A taut and complex thriller, this movie won't be easy for forget.
A guilty pleasure film that is more fun than it deserves to be.
This high-stakes drama is infected with too many characters and a silly subplot.
A well-written and incredibly smart film about baseball.
An atrocious waste of time, this "Night" is one you'll quickly forget.
An honest, earnest and powerful look at a young person's battle with cancer.
A brilliant political thriller about strategy, loyalty and idealism that is willing to unmask candidates who build their campaigns on slogans, not policies.
This remake could have audiences tapping their feet... as they wait for it to end.
A well-told and credible look at the economic collapse from the perspective of one company's employees.
A fun, family-friendly comedy that feels like a combination of Austin Powers and Ernest P. Worrell.
A refreshing departure from the "Shrek" films, this animated comedy is jam-packed with witty dialogue and charismatic characters.
The director offers up an unfocused but intriguing alternate look at William Shakespeare.
A well-made film with two strong leads that never fully appreciates the romance at its core.
An idealistic and powerful summer film with great characters and a wonderful script.
Raunchy and unfunny, this sequel feels like a simple retread of its predecessor.
Hard-core fans of the series with enjoy it but others should steer away from this over-the-top action flick.
A watchable and satisfying family film.
Director Darren Aronofsky builds an incredible atmosphere for an over-the-top story that doesn't deserve it.
A bland but innocuous film that fails to take advantage of its two likable leading characters.
Jim Carrey succeeds but the film is too mean-spirited and its supporting players too one-dimensional to make this story worthwhile.
A good old-fashioned adventure story, this family-friendly film benefits from several outstanding supporting characters.
movie_title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Voyage of the Dawn Treader (2010)

movie_review_blurb: A silly inane story lacking strong characters and ay sense of adventure.
Ryan Gosling is sadly miscast as the villain in this poorly-written drama.
Driven by great performances and great characters, this drama is a must-see.
An inspiring story about one man's quest to overcome a speech impediment to lead his nation.
A geniunely creepy film that takes faith and its subject matter seriously.
A cold but commendable relationship drama.
A brainless and easily-forgettable thriller.
Lacking any great surprises, this story meanders along trying to prolong the dilemma for as long as possible.
Aside from the James Franco cameo, this story is one disappointment after another.
Despite some of its one-dimensional characters, this drama captures the sacrifices that people make during periods of unemployment.
An oddly-disappointing action-packed film that feels more like a science fiction epic than a Superman reboot.
Aside from its unromantic plot, "Attached" is over-sexed, overdone and overcome by a terrible script.
The strong special effects can't overcome the story's sour focus on pain and hopelessness.
This bloated drama is redeemed by its focus of a man caught between two distinctive and memorable worlds.
Instead of attempting to create a unique thriller, the filmmakers chose to make a typical one with bland characters and lackluster twists.
Although this drama offers up some interesting ideas about free will and faith, the story isn't smart enough to focus on these topics in an intelligent way.
Like its characters, this drama plods along but its compelling plot makes it worth seeing.
A light-hearted and fun look at the life and achievements of the young superstar.
Gary Oldman is the one bright light in this tired drama that deserves neither his talent or your time.
The first truly terrible picture of 2011.
A solid but unspectacular story that is aided geatly by its four likeable leads.
A fast-paced intelligent legal thriller.
This unfunny comedy isn't worth leaving home for.
A solid and inspiring story about faith and family.
Lacking the charm and humor of the original, this unfunny remake is completely unnecessary.
Easily rises up its peers in the genre and is a suspenseful sequel worth screaming about.
The thriller is fun and action-packed but a few major plot holes and a few lazy twists definitely weigh it down.
An endlessly creative cinematic creation, this brilliant animated film exceeds all tired expectations and delivers the first fantastic movie of 2014.
This remake is fun, lighthearted and enormously entertaining. A great family film.
Each vanquished man must be brutally massacred and approximately four gallons of blood must spurt out graphically- sometimes in slow motion-- in this tiring prequel/sequel.
A unique perspective on the resurrection makes this Biblical production truly stand out.
An unlikely hero and a unique story help make this inspiring sports drama overcome its shortcomings.
"Gods of Egypt" is an over-the-top, superficial and flashy drama. It's also a lot of fun.
A satisfying combination of "24" and "Die Hard."
This kind-hearted and compassionate drama imagines the youthful life of Jesus.
Reminiscent of "Toy Story" in its ability to create a wonderfully colorful world of its own, "Zootopia" is a fun film with undeniably important themes about diversity, inclusion and self-worth.
Reminiscent of a Hitchcock film, this drama unfolds with a powerful intensity that will leave you guessing until its very end.
This is a film that wants to be cutting edge but deserved to be left on the cutting room floor.
Jennifer Garner delivers a standout performance in this uplifting and heartfelt drama.
As a comedy, the feature isn't laugh-out-loud funny but the filmmakers seem to be aiming for a greater goal here: relevance.
The "Divergent" series wasn't strong to begin with but this latest entry reaches a new low point.
There's a modicum of depth in the new superhero drama. Unfortunately, it's buried underneath a grim fa√ßade and an unrepentant reliance on loud fight sequences.
movie_title: Batman v Superman: Dawn of Justice (2016)

movie_review_blurb: A respectable and light-hearted sequel that's as comforting as a nice piece of baklava.
Just when you think you know what Quentin Tarantino will do next, you realize just how wrong you are as evidenced by this great addition to the director's oeuvre.
A commendable drama that, despite some flaws, raises serious questions about religious prosecution and political correctness.
An intense supernatural thriller that is as anxiety-producing as it is geniunely unpredictable.
There's a lot to love about Melissa McCarthy as a comedic performer. Few of those qualities are on display here.
If a person wants to take part in a first-person action game, they should just play a first-person action game.
The premise and the setting are far more chilling than the film itself,.
This remake awakens the imagination with visually-stunning sequences and an emotionally-driven story.

Intense and provocative, this is a thriller that raises serious questions about the ethics of drone strikes and the possible repercussions of electing malleable politicians who are often unwilling to make hard decisions in the heat of battle.
An unnecessary sequel that lacks the sparkle and creative exuberance that made the original stand out.
A daring and admirable comedy that never loses its sense of humor even when it tackles tough subjects that other films wouldn't dare to address.
An all-star cast and an intriguing premise are wasted in a flawed thriller that offers one unbelievable plot twist after another.
Simplistic, contrived and schmaltzy, this is a film that has good intentions (celebrating mothers) but lacks the ambition to offer up anything thoughtful or worthwhile.
The film's self-awareness doesn't extend to the plot, which is a cliched mess.
Hilarious and heartfelt, this comedy effectively balances its ludicrous plot with its tremendous affection for the title character.
Marvel has defied expectations yet again with this action-packed but thought-provoking entry that masterfully introduces Tom Holland as the next Spider-Man.
The bizarre but intriguing premise here is undermined because the film isn't willing to take risks to embrace the absurdity of the situation.
A commendable but conventional look at Jesse Owen's tremendous success on and off the track.
Moore's strength here isn't in answering all of the questions he poses. It's in raising the questions to begin with.
"How to be Single" doesn't know how to be funny and lacks the self-awareness and wit that would've made this film truly work.
Although the movie lasts a bit longer than it should, it still offers some great (and bloody) fun.
Despite a few fumbles, this moving film about the power of prayer still packs quite a punch.
A fun and warm-hearted first hour here is undermined by the film's preachy and unfocused second half.
An inspiring film that shows the power of faith and forgiveness on and off the field.
When the cast starts singing "Here we are now, entertain us," it sounds like more of a plea from the audience itself. Shouldn't a story about Peter Pan be at least a little entertaining?
Despite some editing issues and some acting miscues, this drama's heart is in the right place which helps it overcome some of its greatest flaws.
This thoughtful drama presents real and legitimate questions about drone strikes and smartly lets the audience make their own decisions on these issues.
Fair-minded and thoughtful, this documentary lets viewers witness the rise of political punditry.
This half-baked dramedy about cooking feels more like a lackluster television pilot rather than a feature-length film.
It's hard to walk into a film with the name "Truth" without great expectations about its content. This one fails to meet any of those expectations.
An undeniable letdown after "Skyfall," this Bond feature is thoughtful in its subject matter but complacent in its execution.
Smart, funny and unique, this comedy shows off the undeniable strengths of its star, Amy Schumer .
Its emotional center is hard to forget but considering the powerful subject material, it's hard not to leave the theater without a sense of disappointment.
It's hard to "Love the Coopers." Actually, it's hard to even like them. The family is so overbearing and stereotypical that it's difficult to see why this great ensemble cast signed on to play them.
A fitting ending to a strong series, this final chapter offers the action that audiences would hope for and the emotional climax that fans deserve.
This film doesn't mark a continuation of the series. It marks a rebirth of it. One of the best films of the year.
James McAvoy is great fun in this unique and visually-exciting adaptation of the well-known story.
Outrageous and devilishly fun, this film is a combination of 'Gremlins' & 'Christmas Vacation.'
Despite featuring an incredible true story, Ron Howard's latest drama lacks the characters and the insight to truly stand out.
movie_title: In the Heart of the Sea (2015)

movie_review_blurb: A hilarious Christmas comedy that deftly mixes drug-fueled humor with holiday sentimentality.
The force is strong in this spirited sequel. This is the movie that "Star Wars" fans have been waiting decades for.
movie_title: Star Wars: Episode VII - The Force Awakens (2015)

movie_review_blurb: An epic intergalactic masterpiece.
movie_title: Star Wars: Episode IV - A New Hope (1977)

movie_review_blurb: Tina Fey and Amy Poehler are two talented performers who can achieve comedic brilliance in worthy projects. This film isn't one of them.
Jennifer Lawrence does a tremendous job as the title character in this inventive and inspiring drama.
Hilarious and horrifying, director Adam McKay delivers a scathing film that would be hard to believe if it wasn't actually true.
An incredible cinematic experience that is both shocking in its violence and awe-inspiring in its depiction of one's man struggle to survive in the brutal wilderness.
Director Michael Bay slows down his usual frantic pace to offer a stirring but action-packed portrait of the 2012 Benghazi attacks.
movie_title: 13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers Of Benghazi (2016)

movie_review_blurb: This is De Niro like you've never seen him before. That's not a good thing. It's hard not to wonder why the "Godfather 2" star ended up starring as "Dirty Grandpa."
An interesting concept is overshadowed by predictable plot developments and forgettable characters.
A commendable achievement, this drama features an old-fashioned story and worthwhile effects that make the rescue sequences truly stand out.
A funny, fresh and undeniably self-deprecating hero is enough to make this Marvel movie stand out among its peers.
A populist thriller that both sides of the political aisle can appreciate.
A commendable achievement, this HBO movie powerfully captures President Johnson's ability to bully, cajole and manipulate people to vote the way he wanted.
A fun but admittedly violent comedy that features a truly great standout performance by Ryan Gosling.
A tremendous achievement, this Mel Gibson-directed drama is one of the year's best.
This new feature lacks the magic and the idealism of the "Harry Potter" films.
movie_title: Fantastic Beasts and Where to Find Them (2016)

movie_review_blurb: Distinct and sensitive, this unique feature offers an emotional and enthralling look at the former first lady.
An origin story that stays true to its predecessors while crafting its own unique identity.
movie_title: Rogue One: A Star Wars Story (2016)

movie_review_blurb: A movie that offers big questions but oftentimes settles for the easiest answers.
It may be predictable but it's also one of the most uplifting and triumphant movies of the year.
Like "The LEGO Movie," this film is exciting, fresh and a pure delight for the whole family.
It's as if Quentin Tarantino took the reigns of the X-Men franchise and offered his own perspective on Wolverine and Professor Xavier.
A smart thriller that is more interested in provocative ideas than it is in simply scaring the audience.
A beautifully shot film that delves powerfully into some deep questions about faith.
Director Warren Beatty tries to do too much in this nostalgic drama and the plot suffers because of it.
A satisfying entry that benefits greatly from the interplay between its characters.
Jessica Chastain brings this true story to life with a subtle and poignant performance.
The plot has some underlying issues but the overall film works despite its flaws.
A timely premise is wasted in this forgettable thriller that never fully embraces its potential.
This follow-up plays out like a traditional sequel but should still please fans of the long-running franchise.
Fast-paced, exhilarating and impeccably-cast, this action feature is one of the year's best offerings.
Despite a worthy cast and a fun premise, this comedy feels like a missed opportunity.
Exciting action sequences, a great sense of humor and a terrific turn by Tom Holland make this reboot stand out.
A stirring conclusion that features great special effects and another incredible performance from Andy Serkis.
movie_title: War for the Planet of the Apes (2017)

movie_review_blurb: Christopher Nolan's direction and Han Zimmer's music combine to make this war film an unforgettable cinematic experience.
Although the plot is underwhelming, the action sequences really stand out with Theron leading the way with a commanding performance.
A fast-paced and satisfying thriller that works (despite its numerous flaws) because of Halle Berry's strong lead performance.
A well-crafted horror film that relies on tension and suspense, rather than simple scares.
This romantic comedy plays it safe too often to really stand out in this genre.
This wonderfully dark story offers a mix of solid laughs and great scares and really brings this Stephen King novel to life.
Tom Cruise seems to be having a great time playing this real-life figure but the film never goes beyond the superficial elements of this man's life.
[Gal] Gadot is particularly memorable as the lead character here.
This romantic comedy aims to please but with superficial characters with unclear motives, it ultimately falls flat.
There's an interesting premise here but the filmmakers never fully take advantage of it.
For a movie about such a complicated figure, Stone seems to remove the complications from the story.
A well-crafted and patient remake that takes the time to develop its characters before the large-scale violence ensues.
Over-the-top and ridiculous, this sequel seems to exist in a different world than the one we live in.
Some of the gags do feel a bit repetitive but there are enough funny moments here for this film to stand out on its own.
For a series that has stood out for its uniqueness, this sequel feels sadly traditional and bland.
Families of all ages deserve a lot better than this.
Unabashedly fun and goofy, this film offers viewers an entertaining escapist ride.
movie_title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Out of the Shadows (2016)

movie_review_blurb: There are a few fun moments here but not enough to overcome the film's many flaws.
A dour and disappointing sequel to the energetic 2010 Tim Burton feature.
This comedy is great fun and serves as the perfect star vehicle for the hilarious Andy Samberg.
Dwayne Johnson steals the show in this solid comedy, which lets The Rock show off a side of him we haven't seen before.
Dory, the unforgettable character from "Finding Nemo," is given her own showcase here and the Pixar team truly does a tremendous job bringing her poignant and personal story to life.
Despite the numerous cliches that plague the feature's first half, this romantic drama has enough charm and warmth to recommend it.
The visuals are solid but the story meanders and the lackluster characters make this adaptation feel like a drag.
An intense and well-made thriller that will make viewers nervous before they step into the ocean this summer.
Outrageous and oftentimes ridiculous, this big-budget action film is bursting with energy and a palpable sense of fun.
Tarzan, Jane and nearly everyone involved here deserved better than this unremarkable adaptation.
This sequel drops the maze and loses its identity. The mystery at the heart of the original is replaced with something far more generic here.
The focus here on battling political ideologies (pro-purge versus anti-purge) makes this third entry stand out in the series.
This animated feature has a few great scenes but young children should steer clear because of the film's darker moments.
A hilarious reboot that embraces the original's spirit while offering a unique voice all its own.
A traditional but energetic ride.
Creepy and chilling, this horror film takes a simple concept and runs with it to great success.
A conventional sequel that should please series fans but will disappoint those looking for a unique story in this franchise.
Despite some major flaws, this film still packs a punch thanks to the performances of Will Smith and Margot Robbie and a few solid action scenes.
It may have a goofy premise but it's funnier and more enjoyable than I expected.
This exciting but admittedly flawed remake brings the timeless story back to life for a new generation to appreciate.
A satisfying comedy that is as shocking as it is outrageous.
An inspirational sports drama that dares to ask difficult questions about faith.
An intensely satisfying thriller packed with undeniable tension and shocking surprises.
A commendable achievement that offers a fuller and more three-dimensional look at the heroic pilot than we've seen before.
A predictable and cliched affair featuring seemingly intelligent characters who can't stop making terrible decisions.
Offers viewers the opportunity to understand and appreciate more fully the powerful success story of Hillsong United.
Anna Kendrick steals the show when she's onscreen but one wishes that the script itself was worthy of this concept and her talent.
movie_title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates (2016)

movie_review_blurb: One only wishes that this gangster film was as memorable and riveting as the great lead performance of Johnny Depp.
This is a step up from several of its predecessors but it still feels like the filmmakers wasted anopportunity to reinvigorate the franchise.
movie_title: Pirates of the Caribbean: Dead Men Tell No Tales (2017)

movie_review_blurb: Writer/director M. Night Shyamalan has a comeback of sorts with this suspenseful drama, which isn't as strong as his earlier works but is a lot better than some of his most recent efforts.
If you want to talk about the health care crisis in this country, I suggest you watch this movie.
It made me laugh enough for it to merit a tepid endorsement.
Too often settles for horror cliches rather than focusing in on its thoughtful premise.
A movie about intelligence that isn't half as smart as it pretends to be.
This dark, complex and ultimately mournful look at intelligence officials aiming to take down a financial supporter of terrorism features one of Philip Seymour Hoffman's best performances.
The script has its moments but it lacks the unadulterated sense of fun that was so integral to many of the earlier Marvel movies.
Chadwick Boseman steals the show in this electric look at the unforgettable life of James Brown.
This drama loses its momentum when it focuses too much on its mentally unstable main character and never builds a solid narrative around him.
A B-movie that can't decide if it wants to be "Sharknado"-lite or a "Twister" ripoff.
One of the nicest surprises of the summer, this reboot actually delivers what audiences are craving.
Helen Mirren is delightful in this lovely little cinematic treat.
After its silly last installment, this series is now showing signs of growth and maturity but not enough to recommend the new feature.
A beautiful and memorable adaptation of the beloved Lois Lowry book. Fans of the novel will not be disappointed.
A formulaic comedy that is lifted by the physical comedy and charm of the wonderfully-underrated Jake Johnson.
A few great nods to the audience and a buoyant performance by Antonio Banderas help enliven the action.
This is a different kind of sports movie but it's also one that is undermined by cliches and bland dialogue.
As silly and melodramatic as the gimmick at its core.
The plot may meander a bit but this sequel is still worth seeing for its magnificent visuals and a few choice cameos that keep the story humming along.
movie_title: Frank Miller's Sin City: A Dame to Kill For (2014)

movie_review_blurb: Bad. Really bad. This wannabe Bond movie features many elements of Brosnan's Bond films except for one: quality. This is easily one of the year's worst films.
A lovely family-friendly tale that amazingly carries on the story without losing any of its predecessor's charms.
A painstaking look at the heart-breaking situation that unfolded as the Vietnam War came to an abrupt end.
A bland twist can't save this movie from its own repetitive flaws and its uninspired script.
A dark but enthralling drama that casts a shadow of violence over every scene.
It may not be the next "Hunger Games" but this new adaptation of a young adult novel offers enough to keep viewers enthralled.
One of the best film casts of 2014 work together to make one of the worst films of 2014.
movie_title: This Is Where I Leave You (2014)

movie_review_blurb: A "romantic comedy" that is neither romantic or comedic. It is as unambitious as its misguided main characters.
King Kong ain't got nothing on "The Equalizer."
An absolute delight.
Surprisingly effective, this horror movie knows how to build real suspense and then pay it off with great scares.
It offers up everything a summer blockbuster should: intelligence, great visual effects and an emotional core that stays with you after the lights come back on.
movie_title: Dawn Of The Planet Of The Apes (2014)

movie_review_blurb: A genuinely creepy thriller that relies on its story rather than scary music to build suspense.
A waste of McCarthy's considerable talent, this comedy is painfully groan-inducing and obnoxious.
The first twenty minutes are great with Wahlberg stealing the show as a wannabe inventor but when the Transformers arrive onscreen, it all goes downhill.
A goofy, brainless, but undeniably fun ride.
Strong performances from the two lead actors bring this true story to life in this captivating drama.
For those who thought "The Fast and the Furious" films were too realistic, "Need for Speed" is the movie for you.
For those new to the character, this smart mystery succeeds in introducing viewers to this delightful little world.
It's like a super-violent version of 'The Breakfast Club' without that film's wit or charm.
It's not as fresh as its predecessor but it doesn't need to be. This is still a clever and entertaining film.
Loud, obnoxious and one of the year's worst.
A fresh Marvel adventure that stands high above its predecessor and even surpasses "The Avengers" in its technique and execution.
Nicolas Cage returns to form in this harsh but eye-opening drama that also features a great performance from the late Gary Poulter.
A football movie that expertly plays like a chess match.
This spiritual drama isn't as straightforward as its title suggests and it's all the better for it.
If you like defecation jokes, you will love 'The Other Woman.'
This action film takes itself too seriously and undermines its B-movie roots.
Less coherent and more generic than its predecessor, this superhero sequel is an obvious misstep in the franchise.
A magnificently unsettling thriller that will shock and engage viewers from its opening moment to its final powerful shot.
Subtle and heartbreaking, this revenge drama will be hard to forget.
This monster movie commits one of the cardinal sins of the genre: it's boring.
A formulaic but strong Disney family drama that works better than it should.
Shocking and eye-opening, this documentary sheds light on why-- in the midst of a health food craze-- our nation's obesity problem is only getting worse.
This low-budget and character-driven drama should be applauded for its realistic portrait of a world slowly coming to grips with an alien invasion.

After a fire alarm disrupted a recent screening of this film, many of the audience members I was with left the theater knowing that this obnoxious and offensive comedy was not going to get any better.
Sequels can offer more of the same stories and characters that made their predecessors so successful or they can dare to be more. This movie dares to be more.
A passionately-written and heart-wrenching portrayal of real life events, this drama painfully offers a look at the earliest victims of the AIDS epidemic.
A smart and authentic adaptation that never loses focus of its characters in its depiction of a potent tragic love story.
'Groundhog Day' was a great film but 'Battle: Los Angeles' was a lousy one and this feels like a combination of both.
movie_title: Live Die Repeat: Edge of Tomorrow (2014)

movie_review_blurb: Marion Cotillard offers up one of her best performances in this painful but thought-provoking drama.
Offering a dramatically darker story, this feature serves as an animated homage to 'The Empire Strikes Back.'
The plot isn't original but the humor is fresh and the humor is the reason we see these movies.
A delightful cinematic gem.
Jenkins and Hedlund do great work here but it's the unnecessary supporting characters who undermine what could've been a strong drama.
A comedy about a fraternity that doesn't underestimate its audience. Sign me up.
Duvall and Downey Jr. deliver standout performances in this honorably compelling family drama.
This Biblical epic depicts Noah's story on a brutally person level that helps this picture overcome its obvious weaknesses.
Smart, unique, and distinct, this feature won't be easy to forget.
For a film about standing out, this adaptation of a young adult novel fits its mold too predictably.
If you think jokes about prison rapes are funny, you might enjoy this movie. If not, steer clear.

A beautifully-crafted science fiction drama that recalls the ingenuity and brilliance of "Jurassic Park."

A notably ambitious endeavor that thrives when it's focused on the main character and his family but falters when it focuses on an unnecessary romantic subplot.
For all its faults (and yes, there are plenty of them), this Avengers sequel is still a lot of fun.

Like the earliest seasons of the show, this comedy celebrates Hollywood excess while mocking the industry. If you liked the show, you're in for a treat.
A disaster movie that isn't a complete disaster. This one offers up some great special effects that compensate for some of the story's sillier moments.
This Steven Spielberg thriller remains one of his best films and one of the best summer blockbusters of all time.
A serviceable but lackluster sequel that is more focused on excess (more deaths, more action) than it is on its characters.
A marked improvement over its immediate predecessor, this film works as a fast and efficient thriller that offers a few great surprises along the way.
"Jurassic World" is the sequel that "Jurassic Park" fans have been waiting two decades for.
A unique and hilarious comedy that replaces schmaltz with an honesty that make this one of the best of the year.
movie_title: Me and Earl and the Dying Girl (2015)

I can't say that it's great but I can't say that I didn't laugh either.

Despite my better instincts, I thought this movie was pretty funny.
Like the runners depicted in this heartfelt sports drama, the movie itself stands out and races past other similar fare.

Smarter, funnier and more entertaining than the original.
To call this drama "audacious" is an understatement. It's a downright masterpiece and a film that will be studied and celebrated in the years to come.

movie_title: The Hobbit: The Battle of the Five Armies (2014)
